page.title: 09Holmfirth Flood-1944
page.content: On the 29th May,1944,a Whit Monday, there was a very bad storm in the Holme Valley.The river rose to 18 feet in places.Mills and houses were damaged and many of the buildings in Holmfirth were brought down.Fields were covered with stone clay and debris.Here are some pieces of information from people who lived during the 1944 flood. {Someone from Elephant & Castle pub} The flood was at its worse between 6.30p.m.to 7.00p.m.It rose to about 4'9" up the building.The water did not recede properly until about 8.30p.m. {Someone who lived on Scarfold} The water started coming in the bottom houses about 6.00p.m.and rose 6 feet altogether.A clock was stopped at 6.30p.m.;fairly soon after the flood waters began to settle.
